 /
Sustainability Summit
Study Hall Summit

at United Nations HQ, New York
February 1, 2019

 

Watch the Full Program:

 

Complimentary admission on invitation

Kicking off NYFW with a Sustainability Focus

Welcoming Remarks by Her Excellency Inga Rhonda King, President of the Economic and Social Council

Opening Remarks by Riefqah Jappie, International Trade Center Representative to the UN, New York

What is the Future of the Fashion Industry?

  • Céline Semaan, Founder & Creative Director, Slow Factory and Study Hall
  • Dio Kurazawa, Founding Partner, The Bear Scouts 

The Power of Collaboration in Accelerating the Achievement of the SDGs
The UN, and Adidas discuss the power of collaboration, rapid prototyping, and material revolution 

Moderated by Burak Cakmak, Dean at Parsons School of Design

  • Nora Vasconcellos, Adidas, Athlete
  • Leland Melvin, NASA Astronaut, MIT Media Lab Director’s Fellow
  • Meral Guzel, Women’s Empowerment Principles Specialist, UN Women
  • Christopher Bevans, MIT Media Lab, Director’s Fellow, Winner of Woolmark Prize for Innovation and Founder and Creative Director of Dyne
  • Dapper Dan, Dapper Dan of Harlem Studio

 

Ignite Talks; Good for the Earth & Good for the People
Focused presentations on key issues at the intersection between the fashion industry and Sustainable Development Goals

Good for the Earth: Environmental-Centered Solutions

  • Sanjeev Bahl, Founder, Saitex
  • Jifei Ou, 3D Printed Fur Researcher, MIT Media Lab
  • Enrica Arena, Co-Founder, Orange Fiber
  • Beata Gutman Krivoshey, President & Founder, Grasshopper
  • Phillip Lim & Michelle Lee The Woolmark Company

Good for the People : Human-Centered Solutions

  • Aysylu Yanturina Darles, Associate Social Affairs Officer, Ethical Fashion Initiative - International Trade Centre
  • Amanda Nguyen, Nobel Peace Prize Nominee, CEO Rise
  • Nonabah Lane, First Nation Scientist, The School of Energy
  • Fernanda Daudt, Founder, Volta Atelier

 

Closing Panel — Sustainable Design: Fiction or Reality?
Key takeaways in improving current supply chain opacities, introducing new materials, and closing the loop on material waste.

Moderated by Michelle Millar-Fisher, Co-Curator at MoMA “Is Fashion Modern?”

  • Adriana Galijasevic, Denim and Sustainability Expert, G-Star Raw
  • Dr. Minoo Rathnasabapathy, Research Engineer, Space Enabled Research Group, MIT Media Lab
  • Pashon Murray, Founder, Detroit Dirt, MIT Media Lab Director’s Fellow
  • Ara Katz , Co-Founder, Seed, Inc.
  • Aaniyah Omardien, The Beach Coop

 

Closing Remarks

  • Céline Semaan, Founder & Creative Director, Slow Factory and Study Hall
  • Lucie Brigham, United Nations Office for Partnerships representative

 

Study Hall
Conferences
New York Times . Mexico City . London . Paris . United Nations . Dubai . New York . Tokyo . Dakar . Cape Town . Los Angeles . San Francisco . Beirut . Amsterdam .

Good for the Earth,
Good for the People

Slow Factory Foundation is dedicated to improving sustainability literacy in fashion.

Using a holistic, human-centered approach, we bridge science, human rights, technology, fashion & culture to develop products, resources and certifications for industry and consumers alike.
